title: Quiz 4: Tool Development & Pre-testing
description: Assess your skills in designing effective survey tools, conducting FGDs, and the importance of pre-testing.

questions.question: Which of the following are qualities of a GOOD questionnaire?
questions.explanation: Good questions are simple, unbiased, jargon-free, and single-barreled. They should not assume facts (e.g., 'How many children?' without asking 'Do you have children?').
questions.hint: KISS: Keep It Short and Simple.

questions.question: Match the question type to its definition:

pairs.right: Allows respondent to answer in their own words.
Offers a list of possible answers to choose from.

questions.explanation: Open-ended = own words; Closed-ended = options; Understanding = knowledge; Attitude = opinion.
questions.hint: Open vs. Closed refers to the answer format.

questions.question: In a Focus Group Discussion, who is responsible for stimulating and supporting the discussion?
questions.explanation: The Facilitator (or Moderator) guides the discussion, while the Recorder takes notes.

questions.question: Which seating arrangement is best for a Focus Group Discussion?
questions.explanation: Circular seating allows all participants to see each other and encourages interaction.
questions.hint: Everyone is equal in the circle.

questions.question: You should pre-test your questionnaire on the exact same group that will be part of the final survey.
questions.explanation: You should pre-test on a similar group, but NOT the study group itself, to avoid influencing the final data.
questions.hint: Would you give the final exam paper as a practice test?

questions.question: Order the steps for conducting a Focus Group Discussion:
questions.explanation: Recruit -> Arrange Room -> Prepare Questions -> Discuss.
questions.hint: Get people, get a room, get questions, talk.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of pre-testing a questionnaire?

options.text: To identify misunderstood questions, confusing directions, or errors.
To collect the final data for the report.

questions.explanation: Pre-testing ensures the tool works as intended before the full survey.

questions.question: Identify the problem with this question: 'Did the MCH talk help to improve sanitation AND nutrition?'

richContent.content:
Question: Did the MCH talk help to improve sanitation and nutrition?

Answer: Yes / No

questions.explanation: This is a double question. A respondent might have improved sanitation but not nutrition. It should be split into two.
questions.hint: It asks two things at once.

questions.question: Focus Group Discussions can be used for:

options.text: Exploratory studies (topics with little known info)

questions.explanation: FGDs are research tools for exploration, testing ideas, and problem-solving, not for clinical treatment.

questions.question: A good questionnaire should range from ___BLANK___ to unknown and from simple to complex.
questions.explanation: Start with what the respondent knows and move to the unknown/complex to build confidence.
